alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula; Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Lower Yukon River; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 5:26PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Strong Winds And Blowing Snow Sunday Night Through Thursday Morning... A series of storm systems moving into the southern Bering Sea will bring strong east winds along with blowing snow and reduced visibility to the West Coast through much of this week. The first storm system impacting the area will move into Bristol Bay on Sunday night and bring strong east winds and areas of blowing snow to the Yukon Delta and St. Lawrence Island Monday and Tuesday. A second, stronger storm right on its heels will move into the southern Bering Sea late Tuesday, bringing stronger east winds from the Yukon Delta north to Point Hope through Thursday Morning. Uncertainty exists on the exact details of each system, but winds may gust as high as 60 mph, remain strong for a prolonged number of days, and could cause large snow drifts to form. A third storm system is possible late next week. Residents should prepare for difficult travel conditions through most of next week, and should stay up to date with the latest forecasts as details become more clear as the storms get closer.
